title: "Hay Baling 101: Essential Tips for Cutting and Storing Hay"

tasks.task: Operation and Maintenance of Hay Baler
subtasks: Identify types of hay balers (round and square)
Describe the baling process (cutting, drying, raking, baling, storage)
Explain proper storage techniques for round and square bales
Address common baling issues and their solutions
Perform regular maintenance on a hay baler
Cut hay in the field
Allow hay to dry before baling
Rake hay into windrows
Drive tractor with baler over windrows
Adjust baler settings for optimal bale size (round vs. square)
Secure bales with twine or net wrap
Arrange round bales on well-drained area
Stack round bales in rows
Handle square bales on pallets
Store square bales indoors if possible
Cover square bales with tarps if stored outside
Identify uneven and improperly tied bales
Adjust baler speed or windrow alignment
Check and adjust baler's tying mechanism
Monitor hay moisture content before baling
Clean baler after each use
Lubricate moving parts
Tighten bolts and chains
Inspect and replace belts as needed
Conduct annual thorough inspection of baler.
